mdRecord.dcterms:title: Maison du Saumon, exterior|detail view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Its first owner, Catherine Maubuisson, ran a large import-export business. The building owes its name to the fish carved on one of the six consoles of the facade, which support the corbel on the first floor. Now houses the Chartres Tourist Office. -- https://www.france-voyage.com/cities-towns/chartres-8540/house-saumon-21085.htm [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
